protocol_affiliation: Department of Microbiology, University of Hawaii at Manoa
manuscript_citation: Wan X, Saito JA, Newhouse JS, Hou S, Alam M (2017) The importance of conserved amino acids in heme-based globin-coupled diguanylate cyclases. PLoS ONE 12(8): e0182782. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0182782
authors: Xuehua Wan, Jennifer A. Saito, Shaobin Hou, Maqsudul Alam

authors_list.name: Xuehua Wan
authors_list.affiliation: Department of Microbiology, University of Hawaii at Manoa

authors_list.affiliation: Department of Microbiology, University of Hawaii at Manoa

components.data: Cells were harvested by centrifugation at 5000 rpm and stored at -20 °C prior to purification.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Cells were harvested by centrifugation at 5000 rpm and stored at -20 °C prior to purification.

components.data: The cell lysate was centrifuged to remove the insoluble cell debris, and the supernatant was filtered (0.22 μm pore size, Corning) and kept on ice until loaded onto the purification column.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The cell lysate was centrifuged to remove the insoluble cell debris, and the supernatant was filtered (0.22 μm pore size, Corning) and kept on ice until loaded onto the purification column.

components.data: The plasmids (His-tagged constructions) were transformed into BL21(DE3)pLysS or Rosetta(DE3)pLysS E. coli cells (Novagen).
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The plasmids (His-tagged constructions) were transformed into BL21(DE3)pLysS or Rosetta(DE3)pLysS E. coli cells (Novagen).

components.data: Colonies were inoculated into 20 ml LB medium containing 100 μg/ml ampicillin and 34 μg/ml chloramphenicol and grown overnight at 37 °C with shaking.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Colonies were inoculated into 20 ml LB medium containing 100 μg/ml ampicillin and 34 μg/ml chloramphenicol and grown overnight at 37 °C with shaking.

components.data: The culture was then transferred into 1 L of fresh LB medium containing 100 μg/ml ampicillin and 34 μg/ml chloramphenicol.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The culture was then transferred into 1 L of fresh LB medium containing 100 μg/ml ampicillin and 34 μg/ml chloramphenicol.

components.data: When the culture was grown to OD600=0.5-0.6 at 37 °C with shaking (250 rpm), protein expression was induced with 0.6 or 0.1 mM isopropyl-β-D-thiogalactopyranoside (IPTG). At the same time, 100 mg/L FeSO4·7H2O and 17 mg/L δ-aminolevulinic acid hydrochloride (ALA) was also added to enhance heme biosynthesis.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: When the culture was grown to OD600=0.5-0.6 at 37 °C with shaking (250 rpm), protein expression was induced with 0.6 or 0.1 mM isopropyl-β-D-thiogalactopyranoside (IPTG). At the same time, 100 mg/L FeSO4·7H2O and 17 mg/L δ-aminolevulinic acid hydrochloride (ALA) was also added to enhance heme biosynthesis.

components.data: The culture was further incubated at 37 °C for 3-4 hours or 30 °C for 6-8 hours.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The culture was further incubated at 37 °C for 3-4 hours or 30 °C for 6-8 hours.

components.data: A cell pellet from 2 L of culture was resuspended in 20 ml of buffer I (200 mM NaCl, 50 mM Na2HPO4, pH 8.0) containing 1mM phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride (PMSF) and sonicated for 8 min (24 pulses of 20 s with 20 s pauses, Sonic Dismembrator 550, Fisher Scientific).
components.name: Section

source_data.section: A cell pellet from 2 L of culture was resuspended in 20 ml of buffer I (200 mM NaCl, 50 mM Na2HPO4, pH 8.0) containing 1mM phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride (PMSF) and sonicated for 8 min (24 pulses of 20 s with 20 s pauses, Sonic Dismembrator 550, Fisher Scientific).

components.data: The BioCAD SPRINT perfusion system (Applied Biosystems) was used for metal affinity chromatography. The column (POROS MC/20, 10 × 100 mm, column volume 7.9 ml) of immobilized Co2+ resin was prepared by first washing with five column volumes (CV) of 50 mM EDTA, 1 M NaCl (pH 8.0) and rinsing with an equal volume of distilled water.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The BioCAD SPRINT perfusion system (Applied Biosystems) was used for metal affinity chromatography. The column (POROS MC/20, 10 × 100 mm, column volume 7.9 ml) of immobilized Co2+ resin was prepared by first washing with five column volumes (CV) of 50 mM EDTA, 1 M NaCl (pH 8.0) and rinsing with an equal volume of distilled water.

components.data: The metal was loaded with 5 CV of 100 mM CoCl2·6H2O, washed with 5 CV of water, and followed by 5 CV of 3 M NaCl to remove residual metal ions.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The metal was loaded with 5 CV of 100 mM CoCl2·6H2O, washed with 5 CV of water, and followed by 5 CV of 3 M NaCl to remove residual metal ions.

components.data: A flow rate of 15 ml/min was used for all the aforementioned washes.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: A flow rate of 15 ml/min was used for all the aforementioned washes.

components.data: Prior to sample loading, the column was washed with 5 CV of buffer I containing 0.5 mM imidazole (flow rate 8.0 ml/min). The sample was loaded onto the column at a flow rate of 0.5-1.0 ml/min, followed by 6-8 CV of buffer I at 2.0 ml/min.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Prior to sample loading, the column was washed with 5 CV of buffer I containing 0.5 mM imidazole (flow rate 8.0 ml/min). The sample was loaded onto the column at a flow rate of 0.5-1.0 ml/min, followed by 6-8 CV of buffer I at 2.0 ml/min.

components.data: The column was then washed with 8 CV of buffer I containing 0.5 mM imidazole (5.0 ml/min) to remove non-specifically bound proteins.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The column was then washed with 8 CV of buffer I containing 0.5 mM imidazole (5.0 ml/min) to remove non-specifically bound proteins.

components.data: The remaining bound proteins were eluted by a linear gradient of imidazole from 0.5 mM to 250 Mm in buffer I (5.0 ml/min flow rate, 7 CV total), and collected in 1.5 ml fractions.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The remaining bound proteins were eluted by a linear gradient of imidazole from 0.5 mM to 250 Mm in buffer I (5.0 ml/min flow rate, 7 CV total), and collected in 1.5 ml fractions.
